content: round 5 knit around round 6 *knit 4 k2tog repeat from * round 7 knit around round 8 *knit 3 k2tog repeat from * round 9 knit around round 10 *knit 2 k2tog repeat from * round 11 knit around round 12 *knit 1 k2tog repeat from * round 13 knit around round 14 *k2tog repeat from * 8 stitches remaining you can either graft the stitches using kitchener stitch or simply cut your yarn pull through the remaining stitches and cinch shut as you would for the top of a hat weave in the tail and check for gaps around the edge of the heel cup see a couple of holes no big deal just close them with scrap yarn terms of use seriously is there anything more annoying than getting a free pattern and having the designer be all but you can only make this out of blue yarn never out of silk i recommend only knitting during the new moon and you can only give one item made from the pattern to a worthy recipient on the 2nd tuesday in march honestly be fair don t say you made up the pattern because that s not nice otherwise use it however you like if you want to make socks to give away or sell them to raise money so you can finally afford that emu farm you ve had your eye on more power to you - just have fun with your knitting and please charge a decent price for your time ok want to use the adamantis heel in your own patterns that s fine as long as credit is given as follows adamantis heel courtesy of rebecca diamond https //whatareyoumakingnow com/patterns/adamantis also i love to see what you guys make so please feel free to tag me on instagram https //instagram com/whatareyoumakingnow or drop me a line on my site whatareyoumakingnow com d credits thanks to kim jones for reading the pattern and spotting some tech errors go follow her on instagram at https //www instagram com/aimou42/ thanks to http //potterheadrunning org/for doing so much good and for inspiring me to get moving resources while i knit exclusively with magic loop for things in the round these socks any socks can be worked with 2 circulars or dpns 4 or 5 your choice just divide the stitches onto needles of your choice and place markers to indicate front/back magic loop http //www knittinghelp com/video/play/magic-loop judy s magic cast-on https //whatareyoumakingnow com/tutorials/jmco-judys-magic-cast-on/ m1r/m1l lifted increases http //dailyskein wordpress com/2008/09/13/lifted-increases/ jeny s surprisingly stretchy bindoff jssbo https //whatareyoumakingnow com/tutorials/jssbo-jenys-surprisingly-stretchy-bind-off/ wrap and turn https //www youtube com/watch v=qun8fwvthuy sock worksheet row gauge ______ sock length ______ gusset length ______ before gusset length ______ to calculate gusset/heel cup row count divide the sock stitches in four and subtract 1 divide the sock stitches in half and add the two sums if your sock is 56 stitches around your gusset / heel cup will be 41 row if your sock
